alert.note: Alert for Cook; Lake (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 10:01PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Cook and Lake IL. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 PM CDT, Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen and additional rain amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible as lake effect showers train over the same areas late this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portions of Chicago, Waukegan, Cicero, Evanston, Skokie, Berwyn, Oak Park, Glenview, Park Ridge, Northbrook, North Chicago, Gurnee, Niles, West Ridge, Irving Park, Austin, Lincoln Park, West Town, South Lawndale and Bridgeport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
